0.title: Working for India where children, youth get respect: BJP MP Varun Gandhi
0.article_body: BJP MP Varun Gandhi on Sunday said he is working for an India where children and youth get respect and where nobody is compelled to bow his head for help. "Until employment ceases to exist in this country and your children don't get jobs, my 'sangharsh' (fight) will continue," Varun added while addressing a program in UP's Pilibhit.

1.title: Monkey snatches IAS officer's glasses in UP; video shows police trying to retrieve them
1.article_body: A monkey snatched and ran away with IAS officer and Mathura DM Navneet Chahal's spectacles in Vrindavan, a video of which is going viral on social media. Several police personnel could be seen trying to retrieve the glasses from the monkey without scaring it away and finally returning them to the DM in the video.

2.title: Manchester United should drop Ronaldo, Rashford from team: Wayne Rooney
2.article_body: Manchester United's record goal-scorer Wayne Rooney has urged manager Erik ten Hag to drop both Cristiano Ronaldo and Marcus Rashford from the team. "[Against Brentford] Ronaldo looked like he needs time to get match fit...he [also] wants to leave the club...I'd let him," stated Rooney. "Rashford looks like he wants to be anywhere but on a football pitch," he added.

3.title: Central Railway to intensify ticket-checking drive in Mumbai AC locals: Officials
3.article_body: The Central Railway (CR) officials said that they will soon start an intensive ticket-checking drive in Mumbai's AC locals. Last week (from August 18 to August 20), ticket-checkers caught 548 passengers travelling in AC locals without tickets and fined them ₹1.7 lakh. Currently, the number of passengers travelling in AC locals per day is over 38,000, another official said.

4.title: 20-yr-old stabbed to death in road rage incident in Chandigarh, 4 arrested
4.article_body: A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death by four men over a road rage incident in Chandigarh's Sector 17/22 dividing road on Sunday morning. All four accused were arrested within five hours. The victim and his two friends were returning home from a party when they encountered the accused driving on the wrong side leading to an altercation, police said.

5.title: Singapore will decriminalise sex between men: PM Lee Hsien Loong
5.article_body: Singapore's PM Lee Hsien Loong announced on Sunday that the government will repeal Section 377A, a colonial-era law, and decriminalise sex between men. However, he also proposed to amend the Constitution to protect the definition of marriage as being between a man and a woman. "Private sexual behaviour between consenting adults does not raise any law-and-order issue," he said.

6.title: 13 arrested in connection with stone pelting on Bihar CM's convoy in Patna
6.article_body: A total of 13 accused have been arrested in connection with stone-pelting at the convoy of Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar, SSP Patna said. Stones were pelted at the Chief Minister's convoy in the state capital on Sunday. Kumar was not present in the convoy at the time of the incident. The glasses of many vehicles were broken during incident.

7.title: Litigation is like bleeding wound: Justice Lalit on legal aid to poor
7.article_body: Litigation is like a bleeding wound and the more it's allowed to bleed, the more will the man suffer, Justice UU Lalit said. Over 70% of population is below the poverty line and only 12% opt for free legal aid provided by legal services authorities, he stated. He was formally launching the LADC system in 365 District Legal Services Authorities.

8.title: Gem of Telugu cinema: Home Minister Amit Shah after meeting Jr NTR
8.article_body: 'RRR' actor Jr NTR met Home Minister Amit Shah in Hyderabad on Sunday. Taking to Twitter, the Home Minister shared pictures of the interaction and wrote, "Had a good interaction with a very talented actor and the gem of our Telugu cinema, Jr NTR in Hyderabad." In response to the tweet, Jr NTR wrote, "It was a pleasure meeting you."

9.title: Govt blocked YouTube midway through my speech: Ex-Pak PM Imran Khan
9.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan on Sunday claimed that the government temporarily blocked YouTube midway through his speech. "This just shows the desperation of those who for their self interest are willing to push Pakistan towards political and economic chaos," he said. Earlier, Pakistan's media watchdog banned live broadcast of Khan's speeches after he threatened police officials and a magistrate.

10.title: Delhi Traffic Police issue advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat
10.article_body: Delhi Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory in view of Sanyukt Kisan Morcha's Mahapanchayat at Jantar Mantar today. Taking to Twitter, the Delhi Traffic Police requested commuters to plan their journeys in advance. The police also shared a list of roads, including Tolstoy Marg, Sansad Marg, Ashoka Road and Pandit Pant Marg, that are likely to be congested today.

11.title: Organisers of public Ganeshotsav require prior permission from BBMP
11.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has allowed public Ganeshotsav celebrations in the city this year on the condition that the organisers of Ganeshotsav in public places will have to get no objection certificate (NOC) from BBMP beforehand. The civic body has decided to go ahead with a single-window agency to provide permission for organising Ganeshotsav, BBMP Chief Commissioner said.

12.title: Boy who left Lonavala home 8 months ago to escape abusive relatives found
12.article_body: A 12-year-old boy, who had gone missing from his Lonavala home eight months ago, has been found. Probe revealed he had left home because his paternal aunt and uncle used to beat him sometimes. He earlier told investigators that he was drugged and when he woke up, he was in Delhi. Process of reuniting him with his grandmother has started.

13.title: Security tightened in Delhi over farmer protest at Jantar Mantar
13.article_body: Delhi Police has tightened the security at Singhu border and Ghazipur border on the Delhi-Meerut expressway. The Samyukt Kisan Morcha has called for a ‘mahapanchayat’ at Delhi’s Jantar Mantar against unemployment in the country. It is expected to be attended by farmers from different states, however, Delhi Police said it has denied permission for the protest.

14.title: Zomato suspends its 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' membership programmes
14.article_body: Zomato has stopped onboarding new members and merchant partners to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' programmes, the food delivery company confirmed to The Indian Express. Zomato said that active members will not be able to extend or renew their memberships once their membership tenure expires. Zomato offered discounts to 'Pro' and 'Pro Plus' members while ordering food online or dining out.

15.title: I'll try to do best I can as mother, acting will take backseat: Sonam
15.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor, who recently welcomed her first child with her husband Anand Ahuja, said, "I'll try to do the best I can as a mother, which means...acting will definitely take a backseat." However, she added she will not stop working completely. Sonam, who had last featured in the 2020 film 'AK vs AK', will next be seen in 'Blind'.

16.title: Hero Vired offers Full Stack Development program with assured placement
16.article_body: Hero Vired, in partnership with Codecademy, offers a Certificate Program in Full Stack Development with Cloud for Web & Mobile. The immersive web development program explores concepts of building applications and is designed for professionals & freshers interested in pursuing a career in app development, it shared. It includes placement assurance and 70+ live sessions with global & Indian faculty.

17.title: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeats world number one Carlsen again
17.article_body: India's 17-year-old Grandmaster R Praggnanandhaa defeated world number one Magnus Carlsen in his last match at FTX Crypto Cup in Miami. This year, Praggnanandhaa had also defeated Carlsen at the Airthings Masters in February and at Chessable Masters in May. Praggnanandhaa finished FTX Crypto Cup as the runner-up with 15 points, while Carlsen won the tournament with 16 points.

18.title: Filmfare withdraws Kangana's nomination, calls her accusations false; actress responds
18.article_body: Filmfare has withdrawn Kangana Ranaut's award nomination after she said she'd sue the magazine for nominating and inviting her. Calling her accusations against the award show false, Filmfare said, "We reserve all rights to pursue any legal action against her...defamatory statements." Responding to Filmfare, Kangana said, "My endeavour is to...stop such malicious award shows...see you in court."

19.title: Video of murder accused cutting birthday cake inside police van in Maharashtra goes viral
19.article_body: A video of a 28-year-old murder accused, Roshan Jha, celebrating his birthday in a police van in Kalyan, has went viral on social media. His followers handed over a cake to him from the window of the van and he cut it. "The team who was given the responsibility to produce Jha in court is facing an inquiry," officials said.

20.title: Pankaj taught me to sit, do dead eyes, open mouth expression: Alia on 'Udta...'
20.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said actor Pankaj Tripathi helped her prepare for the movie 'Udta Punjab'. "He taught me to sit and speak the way the natives do. Then he made me do lot of acting workshops, how to loosen the body, a certain expression which is dead eyes, open mouth," she said, adding she attended different workshops on body language.

21.title: BMC to build 162 ponds for Ganesh idol immersions in Mumbai
21.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has planned to build 162 artificial ponds for Ganesh idol immersion in Mumbai. In addition, the civic body will deploy trucks with immersion facilities and idol collection centres in all 24 wards. BMC has also published its website – shreeganeshvisarjan.com – where citizens can submit their details and get guided about immersion times and places.

22.title: Salman made me fast photographer; he's impatient, didn't give time: Avinash
22.article_body: Celebrity photographer Avinash Gowariker has revealed that actor Salman Khan helped him become a "very fast" photographer. "Salman doesn't give too much time, he is impatient, he is spontaneous...He never used to give me time. He never had time for anything," he stated. Avinash further added that Salman would shoot only when he wanted to.

23.title: Found out about pregnancy on Christmas Day, told Anand over Zoom call: Sonam
23.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor said it was Christmas Day when she found out that she was pregnant. "Anand was in the other room of our London apartment since he had Covid and I basically Zoomed him and gave him the news. Then we called our parents and told them as well," she added. They welcomed their baby boy on August 20.

24.title: Man Utd manager forces players to watch videos of City, Liverpool: Report
24.article_body: Manchester United manager Erik Ten Hag has reportedly forced his players to watch videos of Manchester City, Liverpool and Chelsea. Ten Hag has also reportedly told his players to tell their families that they would "get in early and go home late". The manager has conveyed the message that no player is a guaranteed starter.

25.title: Centre accepts nearly all FIFA demands in its fresh SC application
25.article_body: The central government has moved an application in the Supreme Court, stating that it is ready to end to the "mandate" of the Committee of Administrators as demanded by FIFA. The application accepted nearly all of FIFA's demands including the one to not allow individual members in the electoral college. FIFA on August 15 imposed a ban on the AIFF.

26.title: Govt to name all AIIMS after freedom fighters, monuments: Reports
26.article_body: The Centre has decided to give individual names to all 23 All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) across the country, reports said. They will reportedly be named after freedom fighters, regional heroes, historical events, notable monuments or their distinct geographical identities. The Union Health Ministry has asked the institutes to give suggestions for the names, PTI reported.

27.title: Rajasthan logs 402 fresh COVID-19 cases, 4 deaths
27.article_body: Rajasthan recorded 402 new COVID-19 cases and four deaths due to the infection in the last 24 hours, state health department officials informed on Sunday. The state's active caseload stood at 4,244, according to the department. Jaipur recorded 123 of the 402 new cases, while 66 cases were logged in Bharatpur. Ajmer, Bharatpur, Jaipur, and Karauli reported one fatality each.

28.title: Suit-boot-loot sarkar: Rahul Gandhi says BJP cuts taxes for 'Mitron'
28.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi tweeted that the BJP-led central government was "suit-boot-loot sarkar" as it imposed higher taxes on people and lower taxes on corporates. Rahul shared a graph and said, "Raise taxes on people, cut taxes for Mitron (friends)- the 'natural course' of action for suit-boot-loot sarkar." On Saturday, Congress said writing off loans was the "real freebie".

29.title: Chelsea ban supporter after Tottenham's Son gets racially abused
29.article_body: Chelsea have banned a season ticket holder indefinitely after Tottenham Hotspur's Son Heung-min was reportedly racially abused during last weekend's Premier League game. The incident reportedly took place when the South Korean player went to take a corner in the second half of the match. The English club said that it finds any form of discriminatory behaviour "totally abhorrent".

30.title: Delhi-bound man arrested at Cochin airport with drugs worth ₹60 cr
30.article_body: A Kerala man was arrested at the Cochin Airport with drugs worth around ₹60 crore as he arrived from Zimbabwe via Doha. Authorities say the Delhi-bound Palakkad-native had nearly 30 kg of metha quinol drug in a concealed compartment of his bag. The man was handed over to the narcotics department and the drugs were sent for testing.

31.title: Du Plessis' experience will be invaluable in CSA T20 league: CSK-owned franchise
31.article_body: CSK CEO KS Viswanathan said Faf Du Plessis' experience as South African player and captain and knowing the conditions will be invaluable for the CSK-owned Johannesburg franchise in inaugural edition of Cricket South Africa (CSA) T20 league. "I'm sure that with his entry into...team, we should've a good future," he added. Ex-CSK player Du Plessis was bought by Johannesburg franchise.

32.title: Too young to retire, having so much fun: Red Bull F1's Sergio Perez
32.article_body: Red Bull F1 driver Sergio Perez said he is too young to retire after his contract ends in 2024. "I'm too young for that and still have too much fun...Formula 1 becomes your life. And you can't just leave that behind," said the 32-year-old. Earlier, team boss Christian Horner said Perez would have to consistently perform to extend his contract.

33.title: Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor passes away aged 71
33.article_body: Pakistani singer Nayyara Noor passed away aged 71 on Sunday after a brief illness. As per reports, she was undergoing treatment for quite some time in Karachi. Remembering Noor, her nephew Raza Zaidi tweeted, "She was given the title of 'Bulbul-e-Pakistan' because of her melodious voice." Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif also mourned Nayyara's death.

34.title: Leeds United beat 10-man Chelsea 3-0, remain unbeaten in Premier League
34.article_body: Leeds United continued their unbeaten start to the Premier League season after defeating 10-man Chelsea 3-0 on Sunday. Brenden Aaronson, Rodrigo Moreno and Jack Harrison's goals helped Leeds win at Elland Road. With two wins from three matches, Leeds are currently third in the standings. Notably, it is Leeds' first league win against Chelsea since 2002.

35.title: Advocates must ensure litigants' justice within specified time: CM Bommai
35.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said that advocates must endeavour to provide justice for their litigants within the time frame specified. "The true goal of the judiciary is to secure justice for the common man," CM Bommai said. He added, "The digitalisation has activated the judicial system. The advocates' verdicts and arguments have been digitalised."

36.title: Video shows Putin's aide's reaction at scene of daughter's car bombing
36.article_body: A video of Russian President Vladimir Putin's aide Alexander Dugin reacting to his daughter's car exploding has surfaced online. The video shows Dugin standing with his hands to his head at the scene of the bombing. As per reports, there is speculation that the bomb that killed Darya Dugina was meant for Dugin.

37.title: Casey missed Ben-Jennifer's wedding due to 'parental obligations': Reports
37.article_body: Ben Affleck's brother and actor Casey Affleck has reportedly missed Ben and Jennifer Lopez's wedding celebrations. As per reports, he couldn't attend the ceremony "because of family, parental obligations at home". Ben and Jennifer got married for the second time in attendance of their family and friends at Ben's riverfront estate in Georgia.

38.title: Not fascinated by being remembered: Vijay Deverakonda
38.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda said he is "happy being forgotten" and understands that after a point of time, "nobody remembers" anyone's legacy. The actor said he "should vacate space" for the newcomers to be "loved and worshipped" by the audience. He said, after his retirement, he will switch back to a life of not being in the public eye with ease.

39.title: Guardiola to speak with Man City regarding future after World Cup
39.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said that he will speak to the club about his future after the 2022 FIFA World Cup. "When you play every three days, it's like eating spaghetti every day...maybe taking a break is good," said Guardiola. He has spent six years at City, his longest tenure with a club, and has a contract till 2025.

40.title: Expect exciting three-way battles: Hulkenberg on remaining F1 season
40.article_body: Aston Martin F1 driver Nico Hulkenberg said Mercedes has been "successfully" working hard to ensure they match Ferrari and Red Bull in the second half of the season. "I am sure that the field will be even closer...we can expect some exciting three-way battles," said Hulkenberg. He said there could also be closer battles in the midfield going forward.

41.title: Research needed to help women athletes during menstrual cycles: Jhulan Goswami
41.article_body: India Women fast bowler Jhulan Goswami has said that research is needed to help women athletes during menstrual cycles. "When I was young, I couldn’t even discuss this topic. I would just keep it to myself, not tell coaches, quietly fighting through it," she added. "We can’t give excuses and sit," she further stated.

42.title: Pakistan-born man arrested by Rajasthan Police on spying charges
42.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested a 46-year-old man identified as Bhagchand from Delhi for allegedly spying for Pakistan. Bhagchand, a Pakistan-born, was granted Indian citizenship in 2016, police said. The accused used to supply Indian SIM cards and mobile numbers to his handlers, police said. He also allegedly helped his handlers in operating social media accounts using Indian numbers.

43.title: Leopard dies as water enters Zoological Park in Jamshedpur
43.article_body: A 17-year-old male leopard died after water entered the low-lying areas of the Tata Steel Zoological Park, especially the area near the leopard enclosure, due to incessant rains in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur. The leopard, Mithun, was released into the display area so that he could climb to some safer place but couldn't make it owing to his old age, officials said.

44.title: 'Modern Family' star Sarah marries actor Wells Adams years after meeting on Twitter
44.article_body: 'Modern Family' star Sarah Hyland tied the knot with 'The Bachelorette' star Wells Adams on Saturday, five years after meeting for the first time through Twitter. The duo had got engaged in July 2019. Sarah's former co-stars Jesse Tyler Ferguson, Nolan Gould and Sofia Vergara attended the wedding. The wedding took place in California.

45.title: Attack planned on Kejriwal, Sisodia: Gujarat AAP to police
45.article_body: AAP has sought security from the Gujarat DGP for Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia when they visit Gujarat from Monday onward. "A few anti-social elements inspired by the ideology of the ruling party are planning to attack," said AAP in their application. A team of 50 lawyers approached the DGP's office with the application.

46.title: Mobile internet snapped in 24 Assam districts for govt job exams
46.article_body: The Assam government on Sunday shut down mobile internet services in 24 districts to prevent cheating or question paper leakage as recruitment examinations were conducted for Grade III posts in 48 state government departments. Services were snapped from 10am-12pm and 2pm-4pm. The government will take similar measures on August 28 for written exams for Grade IV jobs.

47.title: Deepika Padukone to make a cameo in SRK's 'Jawan': Reports
47.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone will reportedly make a special appearance in Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan', which is being directed by Atlee. A video has surfaced showing Deepika arriving in Chennai for the shoot of the film. She will reportedly play Shah Rukh's wife in the film. The actors will also be seen together in Siddharth Anand's 'Pathaan'.

48.title: She didn’t talk to me for 3 weeks: Elba on daughter's rejection for ‘Beast’
48.article_body: Actor Idris Elba said his daughter Isan had auditioned for a role in his film 'Beast' but she did not get the part. "The relationship in the film and the relationship between my daughter was, the chemistry wasn't right for the film, weirdly enough," Elba said. He recalled his daughter didn't speak to him "for about three weeks" after rejection.

49.title: IKEA to open small outlets along with mega stores in India
49.article_body: IKEA is planning to open small outlets in cities along with mega format stores in India supported by an online channel, a senior company official said. The company is planning to change its strategy due to changing consumer behaviours. IKEA received the government's approval in 2013 for its ₹10,500 crore investment to open its stores in India.

50.title: CP Rizwan, UAE's captain for Asia Cup qualifiers, is an electrical engineer from Kerala
50.article_body: CP Rizwan, who replaced Ahmed Raza as captain of UAE for Asia Cup 2022 qualifiers, is an electrical engineer from Kerala. He hails from Thalassery and has represented Kerala in Under-19 Cooch Behar Trophy and he was a part of Kerala's Under-23 team. After residing in UAE for four years, Rizwan made his debut for his adopted country in 2019.

51.title: Neeraj Chopra is not 100% fit yet but improving: AFI president
51.article_body: Athletics Federation of India (AFI) President Adille Sumariwalla said javelin thrower Neeraj Chopra is "not 100 per cent fit yet" but has shown improvement. He was replying to whether Neeraj would be able to participate in the Lausanne Diamond League starting on August 26. Neeraj had missed the Commonwealth Games 2022 in Birmingham due to a groin strain.

52.title: Don't take Kohli easy: Yasir ahead of India-Pakistan game at Asia Cup 2022
52.article_body: Pakistan spinner Yasir Shah said batter Virat Kohli shouldn't be taken lightly ahead of the team's group stage match against India at Asia Cup 2022. "Yes, he's not in form because he's struggling to score runs, but he's a world-class player...he can come back to form at any time," he added. Kohli hasn't scored an international century since November 2019.

53.title: Govt awards GI tag to 'Mithila Makhana'
53.article_body: The government has awarded the Geographical Indication (GI) tag to Mithila Makhana. “Mithila Makhana registered with GI Tag, farmers will get profit and it will be easier to earn. Due to Geographical Indication Tag to Mithila Makhana in the festive season, people outside Bihar will be able to use this auspicious material with reverence,” Union Minister Piyush Goyal tweeted.

54.title: Imran Khan booked for threatening Pak judge & police, will reportedly be arrested
54.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan was on Sunday booked under the anti-terror act, a day after he allegedly threatened a judge and two top police officials at a public event. As per reports, the Pakistan government is preparing for his arrest. Khan had earlier allegedly threatened to file cases against government officials and his political rivals over his aide's arrest.

55.title: At least 16 dead after lorry crashes into minibus in Russia
55.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and three others were injured after a lorry collided with a stationary minibus in Russia's Ulyanovsk region on Sunday, according to local authorities. The minibus was crushed between two lorries, Ulyanovsk region's interior ministry said. The passenger vehicle was in a traffic jam due to roadworks at the incident site, as per the ministry.

56.title: Nitish Kumar's convoy attacked with stones, CM not present in cavalcade
56.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's convoy was attacked with stones in Patna on Sunday, but he was not present in any of the cars at the time of the incident. The glasses of many vehicles were broken. "A case has been registered against 15 people and police have already arrested 11 people," the Patna District Magistrate said.

57.title: Medical student found hanging inside hostel in UP's Etawah
57.article_body: A medical student was found hanging from a ceiling fan inside the hostel of the Saifai Medical College in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah. The deceased, Himanshu Gupta (19), was a first-year MBBS student and a resident of Gorakhpur, police said. Notably, Gupta's mother claimed that there were injury marks on her son's body and alleged it to be a murder case.

58.title: India to buy predator drones worth $3 bn from US for use along China border: Report
58.article_body: India is in an 'advanced stage' of talks with the US to buy predator drones for over $3 billion to increase surveillance along the Line of Actual Control with China and in the Indian Ocean region, PTI reported. An executive of US firm General Atomics said deal talks for acquiring the MQ-9B drones are underway between the two governments.

59.title: Pitted against mediocre work: Kangana on being nominated with Vidya & others
59.article_body: Kangana Ranaut, taking to her Instagram Stories, called those nominated alongside her at the Filmfare Awards 2022 "mediocre". "[They're] making desperate blackmailing calls to attend awards after [being] pitted against mediocre work," she wrote. In addition to Kangana, Kiara Advani, Kriti Sanon, Parineeti Chopra, Taapsee Pannu and Vidya Balan have been nominated in the Best Actress category.

60.title: Wore burqa to 'Dear Comrade' screening: Vijay Deverakonda
60.article_body: Actor Vijay Deverakonda, who will soon be seen in 'Liger', revealed that he once attended a screening of his Telugu film, 'Dear Comrade', in a burqa. "Sometimes what I do is I wear...burqa and I go into theatres to sit among...audience. If you see a burqa-clad tall person, it could be me," he added. 'Dear Comrade' was released in 2019.

61.title: Dubai's Emaar Properties to sell fashion firm Namshi for $335.2 mn
61.article_body: Dubai's Emaar Properties said its board has approved the sale of fashion firm Namshi to e-commerce company Noon which is backed by Dubai billionaire Mohamed Alabbar and the Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund. Emaar bought Namshi for $281 million after first acquiring a 51% in 2017 before buying the remaining 49% in 2019. Noon will be sold for $335.2 million.

62.title: I get a lot of strength looking at her: Mahima on working with Kangana
62.article_body: Actress Mahima Chaudhry, who will be seen alongside Kangana Ranaut in the upcoming movie 'Emergency', has said she gets a lot of strength looking at her and the way she functions. "She wears so many hats with such great ease," Mahima added. Kangana will be directing and producing the film in addition to acting in it.

63.title: Cong invisible for 5 yrs, comes with posters before polls: Gujarat BJP
63.article_body: The Chief Spokesperson of the BJP's Gujarat unit, Yamal Vyas, has commented on the Congress' strategy ahead of the Assembly elections in the state. "Congress was invisible in the state for the last 5 years and just before elections have come up with these posters and the things that they will get votes with," Vyas said.

64.title: Will protest if we don't get justice for my son: Moosewala's mother
64.article_body: Sidhu Moosewala's mother on Sunday said she and her husband will start a protest if they don't get justice for their son, claiming that the real culprits were not yet behind bars. "More than three months have passed, we have given enough time to government and administration, but they are taking undue advantage of our gentleness," she said.

65.title: Suriya’s next with director Siruthai Siva goes on floors
65.article_body: Actor Suriya's next with director Siruthai Siva has gone on floors today. The film, which is tentatively titled 'Suriya 42', marks the actor's first collaboration with Siva. As per reports, the film will see Bollywood actress Disha Patani making her Tamil film debut opposite Suriya. The makers will reportedly shoot an extensive schedule of the film in Goa.

66.title: 14-yr-old beaten by autorickshaw driver for resisting rape in J'khand
66.article_body: An autorickshaw driver brutally beat and threw a 14-year-old girl away in a lonely place in a semi-unconscious state for resisting a rape attempt in Jharkhand's Dumka district, police said on Sunday. The accused tried to flirt with the victim and another girl, who was already sitting in his autorickshaw, but the other girl escaped, the release said.

67.title: UAE to reinstate ambassador to Iran 6 years after downgrading ties
67.article_body: UAE said on Sunday that it would reinstate its ambassador to Iran "in coming days". The move is in line with efforts to strengthen relations with Iran "to achieve common interests of the two countries and the wider region", UAE's foreign ministry said. UAE had downgraded ties with Iran in 2016 after Saudi Arabia broke ties with the latter.

68.title: Pa Ranjith's next to be about love between homosexuals & transgenders
68.article_body: Tamil director Pa Ranjith said his film 'Natchathiram Nagargiradhu' is about love, a word which as per him has been changed into "a political term" by the society. He said the society interlinks love with caste and community, an issue that the film will explore. He said the film will also talk about love between homosexuals and transgenders.

69.title: Harry Kane is a player who makes the difference: Antonio Conte
69.article_body: After striker Harry Kane set a Premier League record as the highest goalscorer (185) for a single club, Tottenham Hotspur's manager Antonio Conte said that the 29-year-old footballer is a "player who makes the difference". "We're talking about a really world-class striker who can be dangerous in all aspects...He's (Kane) always ready to help...[and] work for the team," Conte added.

70.title: Wimbledon champ Rybakina's father reveals she wanted to quit tennis 6 months ago
70.article_body: Wimbledon champion Elena Rybakina's father Andrey Rybakin revealed that his daughter, who became the first-ever Kazakh player to win a Grand Slam singles title, wanted to quit tennis six months ago. "Many tennis players go through this (quitting)...Even just before Wimbledon, it was like that…we talked with her in…family for…six days. My daughter calmed down…began to train again," he added.

71.title: Jaipur Police bust illegal gambling racket; 84 arrested including inspector
71.article_body: The police busted an illegal gambling racket in a resort in the Jaisinghpura Khor area of Jaipur and arrested 84 people, including 13 women. Notably, a police inspector of the Karnataka Police and a Tehsildar posted in Bengaluru were among the 84 arrested people. Around 14 luxury cars, one truck and ₹23.78 lakh in cash were also recovered, police said.

72.title: Woman who abused Noida society guard sent to 14-day judicial custody
72.article_body: A woman in Noida who was arrested for allegedly misbehaving with a security guard of Jaypee Wish Town society in Noida has been sent to 14-day judicial custody. The woman allegedly argued with the guard over the delay in opening the gates. As per another security guard who recorded the incident's video, she started shouting and hurling abuses.

73.title: We'll step in to protect Serbs in Kosovo if NATO doesn't: Serbia Prez
73.article_body: Serbian President Aleksandar Vucic called on NATO on Sunday to "do their job" and protect the Serbian community in Kosovo or else Serbia itself will move to protect its minority there. Albanian "gangs" need to be stopped from crossing into northern Kosovo, where most of the Kosovo Serbs live, Vucic further said. Kosovo declared independence from Serbia in 2008.

74.title: China ignored pacts: Jaishankar on reason for 'difficult phase' in Indo-China relations
74.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Sunday said that it's "no secret" India-China relations are undergoing a "difficult phase". "[This is] mainly because we had agreements with China, going back to the 1990s, which prohibit bringing massive troops into the prohibited areas. They've disregarded that," said Jaishankar.

75.title: Federer shares video of practising on court ahead of comeback at Laver Cup 2022
75.article_body: Roger Federer took to Instagram to share a video of himself wherein he's seen practising on the court ahead of his comeback at Laver Cup 2022. The 20-time Grand Slam champion had confirmed that he'll be playing for the first time at Laver Cup since his Wimbledon 2021 quarter-final loss. The tournament will be held in London from September 23-25.

76.title: Army arrests Pakistani intruder near LoC in J&K's Rajouri district
76.article_body: The Indian Army arrested a Pakistani intruder near the Line of Control in Jammu and Kashmir's Rajouri district on Sunday. Officials said no incriminating materials have been recovered from the intruder so far. The intruder is currently being treated in a medical facility after army personnel opened fire noticing suspicious movement from across the border in the Nowshera sector.

77.title: No Look Out Circular issued against Sisodia in excise policy scam yet: CBI officials
77.article_body: CBI officials on Sunday refuted reports that Look Out Circulars were issued against Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and others in the excise policy scam case. The officials said that the process of scrutinising documents is going on and notices are being issued to suspects for questioning. Responding to reports, Sisodia said he is roaming freely in Delhi.

78.title: No consideration to levy any charges for UPI services: Govt on reports
78.article_body: After reports surfaced that the government is planning to impose extra charges to be paid for every UPI payment, the Ministry of Finance said, "There is no consideration in Govt to levy any charges for UPI services." It added, "The concerns of the service providers for cost recovery have to be met through other means."

79.title: 2 Assam imams arrested over alleged links with Al-Qaeda affiliate
79.article_body: Two imams with suspected links to Al Qaida in Indian Subcontinent (AQIS) and the Bangladesh-based terror group Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT) have been arrested in Assam's Goalpara district, police said on Sunday. Their names surfaced after the arrest of one Abbas Ali in July. In Assam, more than 23 individuals have been arrested in recent months over alleged terror links.

80.title: I am trending on Twitter but why: Mohammad Amir after Shaheen gets ruled out of Asia Cup
80.article_body: After Shaheen Afridi got ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 due to injury, Pakistani fast bowler Mohammad Amir tweeted, "I am trending on Twitter but why?" Mohammad Amir had announced his retirement from international cricket aged 28 in December 2020 due to the then PCB management. "People want you to be a part of Asia Cup," a Twitter user wrote.

81.title: Punjab to reserve law officer posts for Scheduled Caste persons
81.article_body: The Punjab government has announced reservation for Scheduled Caste (SC) persons in law officer posts in the state government. Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann said 58 new law officer posts were being created for the same in the Advocate General's office. He added that Punjab will be the first to have such a provision for lawyers from the SC community.

82.title: Underdogs don't give up: UK PM hopeful Rishi Sunak in campaign video
82.article_body: UK PM candidate Rishi Sunak has released a campaign video, which terms him an "underdog", two weeks before the Conservative Party leadership poll is set to draw to a close. "They say beware [of] the underdog, because an underdog has...nothing to lose...underdogs don't give up," the voiceover in the video says. The election's results will be announced on September 5.

83.title: If rape convicts can be freed, why not Sikh prisoners: SGPC chief
83.article_body: Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee President Harjinder Dhami alleged that the Centre was adopting a discriminatory policy towards Sikhs. "On one side...the government is releasing convicts of...rape...while on the other side, Sikh prisoners are kept lodged in jails for three decades," Dhami said. Recently, the Gujarat government released 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gangrape case.

84.title: Bodies of woman, her 2 children found in a pond in Assam
84.article_body: After missing from their house since Saturday, the bodies of a 30-year-old woman and her two children were found in a pond in Assam's Nagaon district on Sunday. The deceased woman, Niru Bordoloi, and her two children were residents of the district's Madhya Tupakuchi village, police said. Notably, police are probing the reason behind their death.

85.title: Man slaps woman toll booth worker when asked to pay toll in MP; video surfaces
85.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a man slapping a woman toll booth worker on being asked to pay toll in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh. The woman hit him back with her footwear. The incident took place when the man claimed that he was a local and should be exempted from paying the toll charges. He didn't have any supporting documents.

86.title: I've boring life, what will you ask: Taapsee on not being part of 'Koffee...'
86.article_body: Taapsee Pannu, opening up about not being invited to 'Koffee With Karan', said, "I've...boring life, what will you ask?" She added all exciting part of her life is out in open. "But that's not exciting enough...[for]...that kind of show," she added. In an earlier interview, Taapsee jokingly said her sex life wasn't interesting enough to be invited to the show.

87.title: Pak must capitalise on India's premier pacers missing out in Asia Cup: Nawaz
87.article_body: Ahead of upcoming India-Pakistan group stage match at Asia Cup 2022, Sarfraz Nawaz said Pakistan should capitalise on India's bowling attack as their premier pacers Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammad Shami are missing out. He added that Pakistan should replicate the same result (win) from the T20 World Cup last year. The match will be played on August 28 in Dubai.

88.title: Pope calls for talks to resolve Church-govt crisis in Nicaragua
88.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday called for an "open and sincere" dialogue to resolve the ongoing conflict between the Church and government in Nicaragua. This comes following the arrest of Bishop Rolando Alvarez, an influential figure of the Nicaraguan Church. Alvarez is seen as a leading critic of President Daniel Ortega. Several priests have been detained in Nicaragua in recent months.

89.title: Ex-CEO of OML which organises NH7 Weekender, raided over Delhi excise policy scam
89.article_body: Only Much Louder's (OML) ex-CEO Vijay Nair has said his Mumbai home was raided by CBI in connection to Delhi excise policy scam in which Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is an accused. OML organises NH7 Weekender concerts and managed AlB. Rejecting reports that he fled the country, he said, "I spoke to CBI officers who were present at my residence."

90.title: Nepotism claims in university appointments to be probed: Kerala Guv
90.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammad Khan on Sunday said that he will order a full-fledged investigation into allegations of nepotism in appointments made to various posts in state universities. Earlier this week, Khan stayed the appointment of Kerala CM's private secretary KK Ragesh's wife as a Kannur University associate professor. She has been accused of landing the job through unfair means.

91.title: Ranveer Singh seeks 2 weeks' time to appear before Mumbai Police in nude photoshoot case
91.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh, who was summoned by Mumbai Police to record his statement on August 22 in connection with an FIR registered against him over his nude photoshoot, has sought more time from the police. "The actor has sought two weeks' time to appear, now fresh summons will be sent...after fixing a new date," Mumbai Police stated.

92.title: Army guys are pissed with the movie: Meera Chopra on Aamir's 'Laal...'
92.article_body: Actress Meera Chopra, Priyanka Chopra's cousin, spoke about Aamir Khan's 'Laal Singh Chaddha' and said, "I have a problem with [the film] on fundamental issues." She added that whatever the film "showed against the Army was not cool". "Talk to Army guys, they are pissed with the movie. I come from an Army family," Meera further said.

93.title: RSS working to make India a model society for whole world: Bhagwat
93.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Sunday said that the organisation is working to awaken and unify the society so that India can emerge as a "model society for the entire world". "We need to prioritise us above 'my and mine' while doing welfare work and this will help us evolve as a society," Bhagwat said at an event in Delhi.

94.title: S Lanka aims to get 10 lakh tourists this year, most from India: Minister
94.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis, the country's Tourism Minister Harin Fernando on Saturday said that the government aims to receive at least 10 lakh tourists this year, mostly from India. Fernando added that religious and cultural tourism between Sri Lanka and India "will make a lot of sense". Sri Lanka is currently receiving approximately 2,000 tourists per day, he said.

95.title: It could be due to workload: Javed on Shaheen's injury ahead of Asia Cup
95.article_body: Ex-Pakistan cricketer Aaqib Javed said Shaheen Shah Afridi's knee injury ahead of Asia Cup 2022 could be due to workload as the Pakistan pacer has been playing continuously. "Team management should deal with patience. Do not panic in this situation and let Shaheen recover completely," he added. Shaheen sustained the injury during the first Test against Sri Lanka in Galle.

96.title: Whole country wants to see Kejriwal as the next PM: Sisodia
96.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal becoming the next PM is not an individual's ambition, but the whole country wants it, Deputy Delhi CM Manish Sisodia said on Sunday. "People see Kejriwal as an alternative to Modi in 2024 because he talks about health, education and employment," said Sisodia. BJP and CBI have a motive to stop Kejriwal, Sisodia added.

97.title: Police allow murder accused to meet girlfriend in K'taka lodge, booked
97.article_body: The police allegedly allowed a murder accused, who was brought to court for a hearing, to spend time with his girlfriend at a lodge in Karnataka's Dharwad on Saturday, following which the policemen were booked. The accused policemen acted like guards and protected the room, reports said. Vidyagiri Police raided the room where the murder accused was staying.

98.title: Somali forces end 30-hour siege at hotel, over 20 people killed
98.article_body: Somali authorities on Sunday ended a deadly 30-hour-long siege by gunmen at a hotel in Mogadishu, in which over 20 people were killed and many others were left wounded. The attack, which began on Friday evening, had started with loud explosions. "During the attack, the security forces rescued many civilians trapped in the hotel, including...children," a police official said.

99.title: Industries can make startups more result-oriented: Jitendra Singh
99.article_body: Union Minister of state for Science and Technology, Dr Jitendra Singh, said that to make the Indian startup ecosystem more result-oriented, industries should partner with startups. Dr Singh added that for the ecosystem to be sustainable, academia institutions need to link each stage with the industry. He said that the science and technology department can provide liberal funding to startups.

100.title: Telugu actor Junior NTR to meet Union Minister Amit Shah over dinner
100.article_body: 'RRR' actor Junior NTR will meet Union Home Minister Amit Shah over dinner on Sunday. Shah is in Telangana to address a public rally in the state's Nalgonda district. The actor is among several prominent personalities scheduled to meet Shah at Ramoji Film City. Junior NTR is the grandson of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) founder NT Rama Rao.

101.title: IndiGo pilots declare 'Mayday' after false smoke warning in Delhi-Kolkata flight
101.article_body: The pilots of a Delhi-Kolkata IndiGo flight on Sunday declared 'Mayday' (the international radio distress signal used by ships and aircraft) following a smoke warning that turned out to be fake, officials said. Pilots of flight 6E-2513 asked Kolkata ATC for a priority landing after a warning of smoke in the cargo area. The flight was safely landed.

102.title: Pegasus spyware maker NSO Group's CEO Shalev Hulio steps down
102.article_body: NSO Group, the maker of the Pegasus spyware, announced that its Chief Executive Officer Shalev Hulio is stepping down with immediate effect. The company has appointed Chief Operating Officer Yaron Shohat to oversee the company's reorganisation and will also lead the company till a successor is named. As part of its reorganisation, the company will reportedly fire around 100 employees.

103.title: We don't influence share prices: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma
103.article_body: Paytm MD and CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma told shareholders that the company has no influence on stock prices, however, the management is making efforts to make the firm profitable. "Macro, micro, international investors, and several other sentiments play a role in share prices," Sharma said. Paytm will post operational profit in the quarter ending September 2023, he added.

104.title: Shameful & disturbing: Shiv Sena MP on Noida woman abusing guard
104.article_body: After a video showed a woman abusing a security guard in a residential society in Noida, Shiv Sena MP Priyanka Chaturvedi said it is disturbing and shameful. "Using classist slurs and abusing people of a state is criminal and shameful, hope UP police ensures she is punished for this behaviour," Chaturvedi added. The woman also pushed the guard.

105.title: Chiranjeevi's 'Bholaa Shankar' to release on April 14, 2023
105.article_body: Ahead of Tollywood actor Chiranjeevi's birthday, the makers of 'Bholaa Shankar' announced the film's release date. Taking to Twitter, director Meher Ramesh shared that the film will release worldwide on April 14, 2023. "Wishing the swagster of Indian cinema a very happy birthday," his tweet read. 'Bholaa Shankar' also stars Keerthy Suresh and Tamannaah Bhatia.

106.title: Video of Dalit man being beaten with slippers in UP surfaces, village head among 2 held
106.article_body: A video of a Dalit man being beaten with slippers by two men in UP's Muzaffarnagar district has surfaced. As per reports, the Dalit man had made some comments about the village head. The duo were called by a former village head to his house, where the Dalit man was beaten by the two. Police have arrested the two accused.

107.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia are 'twin towers of corruption': BJP spokesperson
107.article_body: Posing questions to AAP on the excise policy scam, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla on Sunday called AAP leaders Arvind Kejriwal and Manish Sisodia "the twin towers of corruption". Through a series of tweets, Poonawalla posed several questions, including, "Is it not true that an illegal waiver was given to the liquor mafia of ₹144 crore?"

108.title: 17-yr-old dies by suicide after losing PUBG game in Bihar
108.article_body: A 17-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide on Friday night, after losing a game of PUBG in Bihar's Bhagalpur district. The deceased's family claimed that he used to get upset each time he lost a game of PUBG, however, the police believe the minor could've taken the extreme step after a girl he loved rejected his proposal.

109.title: Govt denies report saying wheat reserves are lowest in 14 yrs, says 'stocks sufficient'
109.article_body: After a Bloomberg report said that wheat reserves in India in August declined to the lowest level in 14 years, the government said the country's wheat stocks are "sufficient" for "our domestic requirements". "There is no such plan to import wheat into India," said the Department of Food and Public Distribution replying to the report.

110.title: Karthikeya 2's Hindi version earns ₹11 cr, RGV calls it 'bigger' than RRR & KGF
110.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma took to Twitter to laud filmmaker Chandoo Mondeti whose film 'Karthikeya 2' has collected ₹11.25 crore so far in the Hindi belt. He wrote, "#karthikeya2 on 2nd Friday doing double collections of Aamir Khan's Laal Singh Chaddha and Akshay Kumar's Raksha Bandhan." RGV added, "K2 is bigger blockbuster than RRR and KGF2...CONGRATS to Chandoo Mondeti."

111.title: NGO owner forces 25-yr-old woman into flesh trade in B'luru, gets her gangraped; arrested
111.article_body: The Karnataka Police have arrested the owner of an NGO called 'Nav Bharat' and her two associates on charges of forcing a 25-year-old woman into flesh trade and getting her gangraped, police said on Sunday. The police have booked cases under IPC Section 370 (buying any person as a slave) and the Immoral Traffic Prevention Act, 1956.

112.title: Odegaard's brace helped Arsenal beat Bournemouth in Premier League
112.article_body: Captain Martin Odegaard scored twice inside the opening 11 minutes before William Saliba's goal in the second half helped Arsenal defeat newly-promoted Bournemouth 3-0 in the Premier League on Saturday. With this, Arsenal moved to the top of the points table. Notably, it is the first time Arsenal have won their opening three matches since the 2004-05 season.

113.title: Priyadarshan to direct his first Malayalam thriller
113.article_body: Filmmaker Priyadarshan will be directing and producing his first Malayalam thriller with Shane Nigam and Arjun Ashokan as the lead. He said the shoot will begin in November "in a start-to-finish schedule of 45 days in Cochin". Priyadarshan, who has also written the film, said the basic idea of the film is inspired by Japanese filmmaker Akira Kurosawa's 'Stray Dog'.

114.title: E-hawala gang with alleged links to Pak busted in Gurugram, 4 held
114.article_body: Police on Saturday arrested four members of an e-hawala gang from Gurugram for allegedly threatening a businessman and demanding ₹5 lakh from him. The victim reportedly received threats through a video call on his WhatsApp number, police said. As many as 99 ATM cards were recovered from the gang's possession, which has alleged links with other gang members in Pakistan.

115.title: Kangana suing Filmfare for inviting her, says 'Shocked they are still nominating me'
115.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has revealed she's going to sue Filmfare for inviting her as they want to give her an award. "I've banned unethical..and totally unfair practices like Filmfare since 2014," she wrote. "I'm shocked to know...they're still nominating me. It's beneath my dignity...work ethics and value system to encourage such corrupt practices...that's why I've decided to sue Filmfare," she added.

116.title: Mammootty meets Mohanlal, pic sparks rumours on 'Harikrishnans 2'
116.article_body: Malayalam actor Mammootty recently met Mohanlal at his new house. The picture, which Mohanlal and Mammootty shared on their respective Twitter handles, sparked rumours that the two are set to star in director Fazil's 'Harikrishnans 2'. While the makers have not shared an official confirmation on the project, the two will reportedly reprise their roles in the 'Harikrishnans' sequel.

117.title: A contemporary I really respected: Taapsee on what she thinks about Kangana
117.article_body: In a recent live session on Instagram, actress Taapsee Pannu was asked to share 'what comes to her mind first' when someone says Kangana Ranaut. To this, she replied, "A contemporary who I really respected." Kangana once called Taapsee a "B-grade actress". Kangana's sister Rangoli had also called Taapsee a "sasti copy" of Kangana.

118.title: Ukrainian ammunition depot storing HIMARS missiles hit: Russia
118.article_body: Russia said on Sunday that its Kalibr missiles had destroyed a Ukrainian ammunition depot storing missiles for US-made HIMARS rocket systems in Ukraine's Odesa region. However, Kyiv refuted the claim and said that the missile had hit a granary. Russia's defence ministry also said that its forces had succeeded in destroying two M777 Howitzers in combat positions in Kherson region.

119.title: Odisha issues flood alert in 2 districts amid Subarnarekha swelling
119.article_body: As the Subarnarekha river swells after incessant rains, Odisha has sounded a flood alert in Mayurbhanj and Balasore districts. The state is already reeling under floods in the northern region in the Mahanadi river system. Low-lying areas such as Fuladi, Chandamaripadia, Kantabanji and Pasimila areas of Balasore town have been inundated, by a swelling in the Budhabalanga river.

120.title: Body of 8-yr-old boy found in canal in Punjab; uncle arrested
120.article_body: The body of an eight-year-old boy was recovered from a canal three days after he went missing from his home in Punjab's Ludhiana. Swaran Singh, the paternal uncle of the deceased child, Sehajpreet Singh, was arrested for allegedly killing the boy, police said. Notably, Swaran reportedly had some issues with his younger brother and sister-in-law, the parents of the deceased.

121.title: Can't declare Satyendar Jain as 'person with unsound mind': Delhi HC
121.article_body: The Delhi HC has quashed public interest litigation (PIL) seeking to declare Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain as a "person with unsound mind" or disqualify him from being an MLA and minister. The plea had been filed by Ashish Kumar Srivastava, who claims himself to be a social worker. Jain is currently under judicial custody on charges of money laundering.

122.title: I consider domestic, IPL, international levels of cricket the same: Venkatesh
122.article_body: Talking about how he adjusts to the requirements of different levels of cricket, India all-rounder Venkatesh Iyer said the pressure is the same across domestic, IPL and international levels. "The time that you take to adapt to...pressure of each level is probably different. But I consider all levels the same," he added. Venkatesh last played for India in February 2022.

123.title: 'Laal...' flopped, it shows superstardom era has gone: Dobaaraa's Vidusshi
123.article_body: Actress Vidusshi Mehra, who currently stars in Anurag Kashyap's directorial 'Dobaaraa', has said that big films like 'Laal Singh Chaddha' have flopped, which shows that "the superstardom era has gone". "Now people don't have the patience for Aamir Khan or Salman Khan," she added. Vidusshi further said the COVID-19 pandemic has "hurt the industry badly".

124.title: 74 artificial ponds to be set up for Ganesh idol immersion in Hyd
124.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is in the process of setting up 74 artificial ponds for the immersion of Ganesh idols ahead of Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad. Out of the 74 artificial water bodies, 28 have already been set up. Of the remaining 46 ponds, 22 will be artificial ones, excavation for which are underway.

125.title: Mumbai NCB busts interstate cartel smuggling banned cough syrup
125.article_body: NCB's Mumbai unit has busted an interstate cartel involved in smuggling banned codeine-based cough syrup (CBCS) by arresting five persons and seized contraband worth ₹50 lakh, an official said on Sunday. The kingpin of the cartel, who also owns medical shops in Mumbai, operated secretly and most gang members were unaware of his name, face and location, the official said.

126.title: Man kills 70-yr-old grandfather over property dispute in B'luru; held
126.article_body: A 20-year-old man, along with his friend, killed his grandfather over a property dispute in Bengaluru. Police arrested both the accused from Mysuru. The 70-year-old victim's grandson was unhappy with him for not parting with the property and not helping him to get bank loans. Both the accused went to his home and smothered him to death.

127.title: Jharkhand, UP facing drought-like conditions: Govt report
127.article_body: As per a state Agriculture Department assessment report, in Jharkhand, 97 rain-deficient blocks across 15 districts meet all parameters that define a drought. In Uttar Pradesh, several districts have drought-like conditions after 64 districts received lesser rainfall this monsoon. Till August 15, in Jharkhand, paddy was only sown on 5.4 lakh hectares compared to 16.3 lakh hectares last season.

128.title: Chahal's wife Dhanashree reacts to facing divorce rumours while dealing with major injury
128.article_body: Cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal's wife Dhanashree Verma penned a note on facing divorce rumours while dealing with a major injury. "As recommended by...doctors... I'll be undergoing my surgery if I wish to dance again," she wrote. "This is when I needed the most support...and this is exactly the time when people picked up some random news about us...It was...hateful," she added.

129.title: Amid polling in West Bengal's Asansol, TMC and BJP workers clash
129.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party and Trinamool Congress workers clashed amid municipal corporation by-elections at Asansol and Bongaon in West Bengal. BJP MLA Lakshman Chandra Ghorui alleged that TMC supporters attacked party workers when they were checking polling stations, and accused them of rigging the elections. BJP also alleged that TMC goons obstructed the polling process by looting votes in Bongaon.

130.title: Woman who abused & hit security guard in Noida society arrested
130.article_body: A woman who allegedly misbehaved with a security guard of Jaypee Wishtown Society in Noida has been arrested. In a video that has surfaced on social media, the woman can be seen shouting at the security guard, using abusive language and pushing him roughly. The security guard filed a complaint at the Sector 126 police station.

131.title: Bengaluru logs 965 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 6.96%
131.article_body: Bengaluru reported 965 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 6.96% in 24 hours, as per data shared by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) chief on Saturday. With the addition of these case, the city's cumulative case tally reached 18,57,744. According to the data, no new fatalities due to COVID-19 were recorded. Bengaluru's active caseload stood at 7,405.

132.title: Don't use sanctions as a tool of pressure: Taliban to UNSC
132.article_body: Taliban government's Ministry of Foreign Affairs in a statement has called on United Nations Security Council (UNSC) to not "use sanctions as a tool of pressure". This comes after United Nations failed to reach an agreement on the extension of travel exemptions for 13 Taliban officials. "Some bigoted western circles are...trying to create distance between Afghanistan and...world," the ministry said.

133.title: Great pride: Anurag on Antim winning gold at U-20 Wrestling World C'ships
133.article_body: Praising 17-year-old wrestler Antim Panghal after she became the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, Sports Minister Anurag Thakur tweeted, "Great pride for the nation." He added, "It's also India's best ever performance at the event with 14 medals (seven men; seven women)." Antim defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in 53 kg final.

134.title: Lumpy skin disease spreads to 8 states/UTs, 7,300 cattle dead so far
134.article_body: Over 7,300 cattle have died and more than 1.85 lakh are affected in eight states and Union Territories with the 'lumpy skin disease', Centre said. Punjab, Rajasthan and Gujarat account for about 95% of the infections, with J&K, Uttarakhand, Himachal Pradesh, Andaman & Nicobar Islands and Madhya Pradesh also reporting cases. The current mortality rate is about 1% to 2%.

135.title: Withdraw circular on 'cancelling' EWS admissions: LS MP to Delhi govt
135.article_body: Lok Sabha MP Parvesh Sahib Singh has demanded the Delhi government roll back a circular, which he said aims to cancel the admission of children in 'economically weaker section' (EWS) and 'disadvantage group' categories in unaided schools. As per the circular, all admissions taken after 2016-17 in the offline mode under these categories won't be recognised by the Delhi government.

136.title: Kareena starts working on Hansal Mehta's thriller, shares script's glimpse
136.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan has started working on the upcoming Hansal Mehta directorial, which also marks her debut as a producer. On Saturday, Kareena shared a picture of the film's script. The film, which was announced in 2021, marks Kareena's first collaboration with Hansal Mehta. The makers had earlier said that the film will be a "gripping and moody thriller".

137.title: Ladakh rolls out EV policy to encourage buyers with subsidies
137.article_body: Ladakh has rolled out Electric Vehicle and Allied Infrastructure Policy to encourage people to opt for battery-powered vehicles for a carbon-neutral future, an official told PTI. The policy guarantees capital subsidy of 10% on two-wheelers, three-wheelers and four-wheelers. Ladakh has offered to subsidise commercial public electric vehicle charging stations for two-wheelers, cars and buses.

138.title: If game vs Manchester United is postponed, we should get points: Liverpool's Klopp
138.article_body: Liverpool manager Jurgen Klopp has said they should get points if their game against Manchester United on Monday night is postponed due to protests. "We've nothing to do with the situation if (United) supporters don't want the game to happen," he added. United fans have planned a protest against the Glazer family's ownership of the club ahead of the game.

139.title: BJP MP seeks removal of Bihar Agriculture Minister over rice scam
139.article_body: BJP MP Sushil Kumar Modi has sought the removal of Bihar's new Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh over the 2013 rice scam. He claimed that RJD leader Sudhakar Singh was charged with embezzling ₹5.31 crore. “When he approached the HC for bail, he was asked to deposit ₹60 lakh after which he was granted bail,” he said.

140.title: Police allow murder accused to stay with lover in K'taka hotel, case filed
140.article_body: A case was filed against Ballari police personnel after some officials allegedly facilitated stay of a murder accused with his lover in a hotel in Karnataka. Reports said that the police produced him before a court and then allowed him to stay with his lover. Police personnel also reportedly stood guard at the place.

141.title: ITBP soldiers cross river as part of 7,575-km long Amrit relay, video shared
141.article_body: A video of ITBP soldiers carrying a Tiranga and crossing a mountain river using a rope while chanting 'Bharat Mata Ki Jai' was shared on Twitter. This is a part of a relay Long Range Patrol ‘Amrit’ that started on August 1 and will end on October 14 after completing a 75-day journey covering a distance of approximately 7,575 km.

142.title: Deep depression weakens, rainfall likely in MP, Chhattisgarh: IMD
142.article_body: The deep depression over northwest Chhattisgarh, adjoining Madhya Pradesh and southeast UP has weakened into a depression. The India Meteorological Department claimed that the depression will continue to move west-northwestwards across north MP and weakens into a low-pressure area in 24 hours. However, IMD predicted that heavy rainfall at most places will continue over the respective areas.

143.title: Pune man held for killing wife, infant after decomposing bodies found in well
143.article_body: Days after decomposing bodies of a 22-year-old woman and her infant child were found in a well in Shirur taluka of Pune, police have arrested the woman's husband for murdering them. The bodies were found on August 8. Officials said that the husband pushed the woman and the child into the well following domestic issues.

144.title: 4 more grain ships leave Ukraine, brings total number to 31
144.article_body: The Turkish Defence Ministry said on Sunday that four more ships carrying grain have left Ukraine's ports. This brings the total number of ships that have left Ukraine under the UN-brokered grain export deal to 31. "In addition, one ship from Ukraine and five ships that will go to Ukraine will be inspected today," the ministry added.

145.title: Japan's Lixil Corporation eyes ₹1,000 cr sales in India in 3 years
145.article_body: Japan-based housing equipment company Lixil Corporation is aiming ₹1,000 crore worth of sales in India in the next three years, a Lixil official said. Bobby Joseph, India and Subcontinent leader told PTI that the capacity of its Vijayawada ceramic plant could be doubled to two million units. Lixil is working on a long-term strategy for the Indian market, Joseph added.

146.title: Mizoram CM issues public apology after video showed daughter hitting doctor
146.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga issued a public apology after a video of his daughter Milari Chhangte assaulting a doctor went viral. Milari was reportedly upset after the doctor refused to see her without an appointment. In a handwritten note, the CM apologised for his daughter's "misbehaviour". The Mizoram unit of IMA also wore black badges to work over this incident.

147.title: Manish Sisodia is 'Liquor Minister’: BJP's Adesh Gupta
147.article_body: Reacting to the alleged liquor scam, Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta called Deputy CM Manish Sisodia "Liquor Minister". He alleged that the excise policy of the Delhi government was sinful, corrupt and tyrannical. "It is seen for the first time in independent India that the Education Minister is the Liquor Minister,” Adesh Gupta said.

148.title: Man hides spy camera in charger, blackmails B'luru woman with private videos
148.article_body: Bengaluru City Police arrested a 30-year-old man, who allegedly blackmailed his woman friend into having a physical relationship with him by capturing her private videos using a spy camera, officers said on Saturday. The accused recorded videos of the woman changing her clothes, police said. He used the videos to demand a physical relationship from the woman, the investigation revealed.

149.title: Kejriwal model failed, corruption reached its peak in Delhi: Union Minister
149.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur on Sunday said that Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal’s model has failed in the national capital. "Corruption has reached its peak," Thakur added. "The taking back of excise policy in Delhi after CBI's raid proves corruption has happened...Kingpin Arvind Kejriwal will have to answer for this," Thakur stated.

150.title: Security increased in Delhi ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
150.article_body: Delhi Police put up cemented barricades and tightened security at the Delhi-Haryana's Tikri border ahead of a protest called by farmers at Jantar Mantar on Monday. The farmers are planning to stage a protest against unemployment and other issues in the country. Farmer leader Rakesh Tikait was detained while he was entering Delhi to take part in the protest.

151.title: NZ to temporarily boost foreign worker intake, alter immigration rules
151.article_body: New Zealand will make temporary changes to its immigration rules to hire thousands of extra workers amid a labour shortage, Immigration Minister Michael Wood said on Sunday. The country will revise its Working Holiday Visa scheme with the aim to attract 12,000 foreign workers. "These measures are about providing immediate relief to...businesses hardest hit by...global worker shortage," Wood said.

152.title: Vijay Shekhar Sharma's reappointment as Paytm MD & CEO gets shareholders' nod
152.article_body: The reappointment of Vijay Shekhar Sharma as Paytm's MD and CEO for a five-year period has been approved by its shareholders. A total of 99.67% shareholders voted in favour of Sharma's reappointment, Paytm's parent company said. The shareholders further approved a resolution to fix Sharma's remuneration for the next three years without any annual increment, with 94.48% votes in favour.

153.title: Slept for 10 hrs after shooting Shehzada's climax scene: Kartik
153.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan took to Instagram to share a picture from the sets of 'Shehzada' and said that he slept for 10 hours after filming the "epic climax" of the upcoming movie. "One of the most difficult, hectic and again a new zone for me," he added. The film, being directed by Rohit Dhawan, will also star Kriti Sanon.

154.title: Kapil confirms new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show', drops his new look
154.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma on Sunday shared his new look and announced that he will soon return to the television screens with the new season of 'The Kapil Sharma Show' (TKSS). The show went on hiatus after Kapil and his team went on a tour to USA and Canada, and Australia. The new season will reportedly air from September onwards.

155.title: Pakistan would've taken 50 overs to chase Zimbabwe's 161 runs: Danish Kaneria
155.article_body: Ex-Pakistan spinner Danish Kaneria has said despite losing wickets at regular intervals during their chase of Zimbabwe's 162-run target, India had an attacking approach. "Many Pakistani fans have said that India lost five wickets while chasing 162...[but] they finished the game within 25 overs. In a similar situation, Pakistan would have taken 50 overs to chase it down," stated Kaneria.

156.title: Police arrest 3 attempting ATM theft in Pune's Nigdi
156.article_body: Three people were arrested by Pimpri-Chinchwad police for attempting to break into an ATM in Nigdi. The accused, identified as Rajendra Popat Bade, Krishna Rajput and Shashank Ghodeswar, were under the influence of alcohol when they attempted the robbery, said Assistant Police inspector S Karode. The accused, he added, were labourers who did not know how to operate an ATM.

157.title: Pune city reports a decline in COVID-19 testing numbers
157.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) limits reported a decline in COVID-19 testing samples. The PMC collected 24,162 samples in August and 12,848 samples in July, which is less compared to previous months. Dr Ashish Bharti, chief, PMC health department, said, "Following a drop in COVID-19 cases and the festive season, many patients are not keen on getting tested."

158.title: No guilt or remorse: Bilkis Bano's lawyer after release of 11 rapists
158.article_body: Bilkis Bano's lawyer Shobha Gupta, while commenting on the release of the 11 convicts, who were sentenced to life imprisonment for gangraping Bano, said there was no guilt or remorse. "Honestly, I don't believe it [remission of 11 convicts] can be treated as a precedent for other rapists and murderers in jail," Gupta said.

159.title: Gotabaya can return to Sri Lanka but must face action: Oppn party
159.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition party Samagi Jana Balawegaya said that while ex-President Gotabaya Rajapaksa can return to Sri Lanka, he must be tried for allegations of misuse of funds as he doesn't enjoy legal immunity. The party's remarks came as Rajapaksa's cousin said that the ex-leader will return to country soon. Rajapaksa, however, has reportedly applied for a US Green Card.

160.title: No regrets about it: Neha Kakkar on being trolled for crying on TV
160.article_body: Singer Neha Kakkar, speaking about being trolled for crying in reality shows, has said, "We don't see too many people who can feel others' pain and who want to help them." She added, "I have that quality in me and I have no regrets about it." The singer is set to judge the upcoming reality show 'Indian Idol 13'.

161.title: If someone thinks I can change team in a day, then we're living in fool's kingdom: Shakib
161.article_body: Bangladesh T20I captain Shakib Al Hasan has said he has "no goals" for the team ahead of the Asia Cup. "My only aim is we can do well in the T20 WC...If someone thinks I can change things within one or two days...then we're living in a fool's kingdom," stated Shakib. "We've...to make a new start in T20Is," he added.

162.title: Japanese PM Kishida tests positive for COVID-19, recuperating
162.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida tested positive for coronavirus on Sunday, a Cabinet spokesperson said. Kishida took a PCR test after he developed a cough and fever on Saturday, the Cabinet spokesperson added. The PM's office said that Kishida, who'd just returned from a week-long vacation, is currently recuperating at his official residence. Japan recorded 2,53,248 new coronavirus cases on Saturday.

163.title: Kuldeep seemed confused if he should bowl fast or slow vs Zimbabwe: Kaif
163.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Mohammad Kaif has said spinner Kuldeep Yadav seemed confused about the speed at which he should bowl in the second ODI against Zimbabwe. "However, the rhythm is being seen. He bowled well in WI. He'll get better when he plays more matches," added Kaif. Kuldeep registered figures of 1/49 in his eight overs in the second ODI.

164.title: People have started saying it's 'paap' not AAP: BJP's Gaurav Bhatia
164.article_body: Criticising the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP), BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia on Sunday said that the people have started saying it’s not AAP, it’s "paap" (sin). "The people of the country are saying that if there is any big corrupt...it is Manish Sisodia and AAP," Bhatia added. His remark came after CBI raided Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia’s residence on Friday.

165.title: Man hacked to death near his house in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta
165.article_body: A man identified as 25-year-old Abu Bakr Al-Amoodi was reportedly hacked to death near his residence in Hyderabad's Chandrayangutta during the early hours of Sunday. Amoodi was spotted lying in a pool of blood by locals who informed the police. Police recovered a dagger from the crime scene. An individual named Abdul Rahman has been identified as the suspected killer.

166.title: No errors in treatment given to Jayalalithaa at Apollo: AIIMS panel
166.article_body: A report by the All India Institute of Medical Sciences (AIIMS) has given clean chit to Apollo hospital where former Tamil Nadu CM Jayalalithaa was admitted before her demise. The medical panel of AIIMS said that the treatment provided to Jayalalithaa was as per “correct medical practice" and no errors have been found in the procedure.

167.title: Rakesh Tikait detained ahead of farmers' protest at Jantar Mantar
167.article_body: Delhi Police detained farmer leader Rakesh Tikait while he was on his way to Jantar Mantar to participate in a protest against unemployment. Tikait was stopped by the police at Ghazipur. After the arrest, Tikait tweeted, "Delhi Police working at the behest of the government cannot suppress the voice of the farmers. This arrest will bring a new revolution."

168.title: Restoration of Peshwa structure in Pune nears completion after 18 yrs
168.article_body: The Vishrambaug Wada, which is one of the last structures built by Peshwas in Pune, will finally be fully open to public as restoration works are expected to conclude soon. The works, which began in 2003, cost the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) ₹8 crore. "Restoration has to be done with patience and taking care of minutest details," an official said.

169.title: Shefali Shah tests negative for COVID-19
169.article_body: Actress Shefali Shah has informed her fans that she has tested negative for COVID-19. "I'm absolutely fine, and can resume work now," she wrote in a note, which she shared on Instagram. She thanked the doctors and her fans for their "prayers, concern and love". She asked fans to stay safe and take care of themselves.

170.title: Tiger Shroff's 'Screw Dheela' put on hold due to high budget: Report
170.article_body: Tiger Shroff's upcoming film 'Screw Dheela' has reportedly been put on hold due to budget issues and average response to the film's announcement video. "Screw Dheela is not shelved. The team hopes to visit this film later when the box office environment is conducive," a source quoted by Bollywood Hungama said. Filmmaker Shashank Khaitan is attached to direct the film.

171.title: Saba criticises KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in 2nd ODI vs Zimbabwe
171.article_body: Saba Karim criticised India captain KL Rahul's decision to bowl first in India's five-wicket win against Zimbabwe in second ODI, saying he was expecting India to bat first. "They again took the logical kind of route," he added. "The reason why we were out of...T20 World Cup [2021] was because of our conservative approach while batting first," he further said.

172.title: Some noticed cracks, decided to vacate: Ex- corporator on Mumbai building
172.article_body: An ex-corporator, while talking about the four-storey building that fell in Mumbai's Borivali recently, said that some families noticed cracks in the building and decided to vacate the flats. "So there wasn't anyone inside when the incident occurred," the ex-corporator said. Fire engines and fire brigade officials had rushed to the spot after the building had collapsed.

173.title: Sixth accused arrested for stripping girl in UP
173.article_body: The sixth perpetrator involved in UP’s Hamirpur incident, where a girl was stripped and assaulted by a group of men, was arrested. All accused, including two minors, were arrested based on the incident’s video, which went viral on social media. The woman was assaulted after she was allegedly caught with a man in a forest near the culprits’ village.

174.title: PMC announces competition to improve roads for safe commute to school
174.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has planned to implement innovative methods to enable students to commute independently to and from school by making roads safer for them to walk and cycle on, as well as reducing traffic congestion. PMC has announced a competition for urban designers to find 'implementable ideas'. The civic body has reportedly allotted ₹1 crore for the initiative.
