348.article_body: Sonam Kapoor, who welcomed a baby boy on Saturday, has featured on Vogue's cover. The cover, shot during Sonam's pregnancy, shows her with her baby bump. "Priorities do change and I think that the child will become mine. The truth...is...they didn't choose to come into this world. You decided to bring them here, so it's a...selfish decision," she told Vogue.

349.title: Would like Chahar, Bhuvneshwar to play together in T20Is: Sodhi
349.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Reetinder Singh Sodhi has said that he would "like to see" seamers Deepak Chahar and Bhuvneshwar Kumar playing "together" in T20Is "if conditions suit them". "In T20Is, you can be a genuine wicket-taker if you have the ability to move the ball both ways and...[Chahar along with Bhuvneshwar] can make...early dents into the opposition's batting order," Sodhi added.

350.title: Earth narrowly escapes collision with 420-foot-wide asteroid: NASA
350.article_body: A 420-foot-wide asteroid 2019 AV13, which was approaching Earth, has flown past the planet, missing it narrowly on Saturday, NASA said. The giant asteroid came 5.2 million km close to the Earth but didn't deviate towards it. Had it struck the planet, the asteroid would've caused huge disaster, flattening a radius of a few kilometres accompanied by earthquakes and tsunamis.

351.title: Chandigarh airport to be named after Shaheed Bhagat Singh: Punjab CM
351.article_body: The state governments of Punjab and Haryana have agreed to rename Chandigarh International Airport after freedom fighter Shaheed Bhagat Singh, Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann said on Saturday. "Had a meeting with Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala on this issue today," Mann added.

352.title: 30,225 animals in Haryana infected with lumpy skin disease; 211 dead
352.article_body: At least 30,225 animals in eight districts of Haryana have been infected with the lumpy skin disease. Haryana Chief Secretary Sanjeev Kaushal on Saturday gave directions to the officials concerned to ensure 100% vaccination of cattle within the next seven days across the state. Of the 30,225 infected animals, 211 have died and 16,939 have recovered, a government spokesperson said.

353.title: In pics: From Jupiter to Earth, images taken by NASA's Voyager spacecraft
353.article_body: After 45 years of service, NASA is planning to shut down the Voyager spacecraft. During their course, the two Voyager spacecraft have travelled farther than any man-made object. It has captured amazing photos of several celestial bodies, including Saturn and its three moons, Jupiter's Great Red Spot, Earth and the moon, Uranus and Jupiter's second largest moon Callisto, among others.

354.title: Maha ATS files case against unknown persons in AK-47-boat case
354.article_body: Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has registered a case under the Arms Act against unknown persons, in connection to the boat that was found with AK-47 rifles off Raigad coast on August 18. The Navi Mumbai unit of ATS is investigating the case, an official said. The yacht with rifles and ammunition was found off the coast by local fisherfolk.

355.title: BJP sole party that works to make country, not government: Rajnath Singh
355.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said BJP is the "sole party that does not function to make the government but to make the country". He was inaugurating the party's new 'Panchkamal' office in Haryana's Panchkula. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar, also present at the event, said the building was not just "a party office but a temple".

356.title: Death toll from fire tragedy at Thai nightclub rises to 20
356.article_body: The death toll due to a fire that broke out at a nightclub in Thailand's Chonburi province on August 5 has risen to 20, Thai health officials said. Authorities had recovered 13 charred bodies from the site of the tragedy. As many as 25 injured are still receiving treatment, with nine of them on ventilators, the local health authority said.

357.title: Chahar is a bit lower in the pecking order in T20Is: Saba Karim
357.article_body: Former India cricketer Saba Karim said that he feels that seamer Deepak Chahar is a "bit lower" in the pecking order in T20Is even when "fully fit". "You have...Jasprit Bumrah and the experience of Bhuvneshwar Kumar and also youngsters like Avesh Khan and Arshdeep Singh. Chahar has improved...but he has been expensive at the death," Karim said.

358.title: Kejriwal, Sisodia to travel to Gujarat next week for poll campaign
358.article_body: Amidst the CBI case against Delhi's excise policy irregularities, CM Arvind Kejriwal said he and Deputy CM Manish Sisodia will visit Gujarat next week. Kejriwal said they will travel with the message that if voted to power, Gujarat will get free and quality education as well as healthcare services. Assembly elections in Gujarat are due in the next few months.

359.title: TMC leader stabbed to death in West Bengal; 4 detained
359.article_body: A Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader named Alam was stabbed to death in West Bengal's South 24 Parganas district on Saturday morning. Police said they have detained four people in connection with the murder. As per Times Now, Alam was allegedly shot at before being stabbed multiple times in Basanti town. The motive for the attack is yet to be ascertained.

360.title: 2 women electrocuted while cutting grass in a field in UP's Etah
360.article_body: Two women were electrocuted to death while cutting grass in a field in Chhitauni village in UP's Etah district. The deceased, Chandravati (55) and Usha Devi (60), died when a high-tension wire broke and fell on them, police said. Notably, the villagers demanded that the district administration and the electricity department provide financial aid to the families of the deceased.

361.title: Terror threat received by Mumbai Police should be taken seriously: Ajit Pawar
361.article_body: After Mumbai Police's traffic wing received several text messages on its helpline number threatening a "26/11-like" attack, NCP leader Ajit Pawar on Saturday said these threats should be taken seriously. "The state government should take this threat seriously and our police are very able in such situations," Pawar said. "But central agencies should also look into the matter," Pawar added.

362.title: We named her 'Antim' so we don't get another daughter: U-20 world champ wrestler's mother
362.article_body: Krishna Kumari, the mother of Antim Panghal who became the first-ever Indian woman to bag gold at Under-20 Wrestling World Championships, revealed how they named her daughter. She said, "We named our daughter Antim so...we don’t get another daughter as we got four daughters." "Antim has become Pehli (first) in the wrestling world today," she added about her win.

363.title: Wrestler Antim creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman to win gold at U-20 World C'ships
363.article_body: Wrestler Antim Panghal has created history by becoming the first Indian woman to win a gold medal at the Under-20 Wrestling World Championships. The 17-year-old defeated Kazakhstan's Altyn Shagayeva 8-0 in the final of the 53-kg category to achieve the feat. Antim had also won gold medal at the Asian Junior Championships earlier this year.

364.title: 13 potential regions for landing the next humans on Moon identified by NASA
364.article_body: NASA announced 13 potential landing sites for its upcoming Artemis III mission to return humans to the Moon for first time since Apollo. Each of these regions is located within six degrees of latitude of lunar South Pole. The regions contain sites that provide continuous access to sunlight throughout a 6.5-day period- the planned duration of Artemis III surface mission.

365.title: Extremely painful: Himachal CM over heavy losses due to torrential rains
365.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur on Saturday expressed concerns over heavy losses to lives and properties as torrential rains battered the state. "The incidents of untimely death of some people due to heavy rains across the state are extremely painful," Thakur said. He directed the district administrations to ensure relief, rescue and rehabilitation works in the affected areas.

366.title: No new cars, greet everyone with namaste, adab: Bihar Dy CM to ministers
366.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav has issued a series of dos and don'ts to the newly-elected ministerial colleagues of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD). "Ministers...will not buy any new cars for themselves in the department," his order stated. Yadav also requested the ministers to be courteous towards everyone and promote the tradition of salutation with 'namaste' and 'adab'.

367.title: Zimbabwe bowler's relative asks Chahar 'Can I touch you?' before taking pic, video viral
367.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a relative of a Zimbabwe cricketer asking India cricketer Deepak Chahar, "Can I touch you?" before taking a picture with him. In the video, the woman can be seen laughing once Chahar agrees. "He is very humble...I liked it how accommodating he is," the woman later said.

368.title: I have done this on my own: Kartik on completing 11 years in B'wood
368.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, speaking about completing 11 years in the film industry, said, "I take pride in the fact that I've done this on my own and with...help of people who put their trust in my capabilities without knowing me." "They went for the craft instead of lineage," he added. Kartik will next be seen in films like 'Freddy' and 'Shehzada'.

369.title: Let's turn this sh*t back: Kyrgios on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open
369.article_body: Wimbledon finalist Nick Kyrgios took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of himself on his arrival in New York ahead of US Open 2022 and wrote, "Young Kygs (Kyrgios) in NY (New York). Let's turn this sh*t back." The 27-year-old Australian has never reached beyond the third round of the US Open in eight attempts so far.

370.title: Rajasthan BJP takes out protest march over deteriorating law & order
370.article_body: The BJP took out a protest march in Rajasthan's Jaipur on Saturday against the state government over its failure to maintain law and order. "The law and order situation in Rajasthan has completely deteriorated to which CM Ashok Gehlot has no answer," Rajasthan BJP chief Satish Poonia said. Under his rule, Rajasthan has become a capital of crime, Poonia added.

371.title: RPF rescues 67 live turtles from train in Bihar's Kishanganj
371.article_body: The Railway Protection Force (RPF) on Saturday rescued 67 live turtles from seven unclaimed bags in a coach of Ajmer-Kishanganj Garib Nawaz Express at Bihar's Kishanganj station. "No arrests have been made so far. RPF has informed officials of the district forest department about the recovery of these turtles," RPF Inspector said. Authorities suspect the turtles were poached from Ajmer.

372.title: Train hits 3 walking with earphones in separate incidents in UP; all dead
372.article_body: Three people, walking on railway tracks with their earphones plugged in, died after being hit by different trains in Uttar Pradesh. While the Howrah-Lal Kuan Express mowed Krishna (20) and Monu (18) at railway tracks near Bhadohi railway station, Pankaj (30) was hit by a passenger train on Varanasi-Allahabad railway line. They couldn't hear the train approaching due to earphones.

373.title: A proud moment: Anil as int'l film critic predicts Oscar nomination for RRR
373.article_body: Anil Kapoor tweeted a video of international film critic Clayton Davis praising Rajamouli's 'RRR' and predicting its place in the Oscars nominations. Clayton, who often makes predictions about Oscars and Emmys, called 'RRR' "a monument to action cinema" and said it reminded him of George Miller's 'Mad Max: Fury Road'. Anil wrote, "A proud moment, looking forward to Oscar nomination."

374.title: Indonesia confirms first monkeypox case in foreign returnee
374.article_body: Indonesia reported its first confirmed case of monkeypox in a 27-year-old male on Saturday. The Indonesian national tested positive in capital Jakarta late on Friday, a health ministry spokesperson said. According to the ministry, the man had returned from an unidentified country with documented cases. The patient is doing "well" and showing only mild symptoms, the ministry added.

375.title: It's a sad thing: Dean Elgar on SA being alloted 28 Tests from 2023 to 2027
375.article_body: After South Africa were allotted 28 Test matches in the 2023-27 Future Tours Programme cycle, skipper Dean Elgar said that it's a "sad thing". "I guess we could be playing more...I can't say too much about that because I might get into trouble," Elgar said. South Africa were at the sixth spot while England topped the list with 43 Tests.

376.title: Liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to Manish Sisodia's aide: CBI in FIR
376.article_body: A liquor trader paid ₹1 crore to a company managed by Dinesh Arora, an associate of Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, the CBI said in its FIR in the excise policy case. Radha Industries received ₹1 crore from Sameer Mahendru of Indospirits, the agency alleged. Arora and others were allegedly involved in managing undue pecuniary advantage collected from liquor licensees.

377.title: 16 dead, 8 missing after flash floods, landslides in Himachal Pradesh
377.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and eight others were reported missing in incidents of landslide, flash flood and cloudburst triggered by heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh in the past 24 hours, a senior official said on Saturday. State Disaster Management Department Director Sudesh Kumar Mokhta added that the maximum damage has been reported in Mandi, Kangra and Chamba districts.

378.title: 4 killed, several injured amid heavy rainfall in U'khand; 10 missing
378.article_body: Four people died and several others sustained injuries due to rain-related incidents in Uttarakhand as torrential rain hit parts of the state, forcing people to leave their damaged and flooded houses, officials said on Saturday. Ten people have been reported missing so far. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami inspected the affected areas and instructed officials to ensure a speedy rescue operation.

379.title: Condom pack used to dress woman's head injury at health centre in MP, pic surfaces
379.article_body: A woman's head injury was dressed using a condom pack along with cotton at a health care clinic in Madhya Pradesh. It was discovered when a doctor at a district hospital began to change the dressing of her injury. The dresser from the Porsa Community Health Centre has been suspended by the state health department, officials said.

380.title: 24.5 lakh tickets sold for this year's World Cup in Qatar: FIFA
380.article_body: Around 24.5 lakh tickets for this year's World Cup in Qatar have been sold until now, FIFA said. Football's global governing body informed that the biggest number of allocated tickets were for group stage matches like Cameroon vs Brazil. "Fans living in Qatar, Saudi Arabia, the United States, Mexico, the United Arab Emirates, England, Argentina, Brazil...led the way," FIFA added.

381.title: CWG gold added fresh boost to Sen's confidence: Father ahead of World C'ships
381.article_body: Indian shuttler Lakshya Sen's father DK Sen said his son's gold medal at the recently concluded Commonwealth Games and the bronze medal at the World Championships 2021 have added a fresh boost to his confidence ahead of World Championships 2022. "He will be a great medal contender in Tokyo, this time, as well," he added.

382.title: Delhi court acquits CM Kejriwal, Sisodia in 2013 defamation case
382.article_body: A Delhi court on Saturday acquitted CM Arvind Kejriwal, Deputy CM Manish Sisodia and former AAP leader Yogendra Yadav in a criminal defamation case filed by lawyer Surender Sharma. Sharma had claimed that his candidature from AAP was cancelled in 2013 Assembly elections at the last moment. All three persons were present in the court when the order was pronounced.

383.title: Montenegro govt collapses over pact with Serbian Orthodox Church
383.article_body: Montenegro's coalition government collapsed on Saturday after the country's parliament passed a motion of no confidence against the cabinet of PM Dritan Abazovic. The no-confidence motion was proposed by 36 deputies (members) of the parliament to protest the recent signing of an agreement regulating the position of the Serbian Orthodox Church in Montenegro.

384.title: Those who oppose CAA, don’t understand it: MoS Ajay Kumar Mishra
384.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Affairs Ajay Kumar Mishra reacted to people's demand for the exemption of the Citizenship Amendment Act and said people opposing CAA are the ones who don't understand it. "CAA is a 1955 law when the then government made...law on citizenship. We've only amended it and [it's]...not applicable to...citizen of the country," he said.

385.title: Heavy security deployed around Hyd venue hosting Munawar Faruqui
385.article_body: Heavy security was deployed around Hyderabad's Shilpakala Vedika auditorium ahead of stand-up comedian Munawar Faruqui's performance on Saturday. BJP members are planning to hold a protest against Faruqui, ANI reported. BJP MLA Raja Singh was detained on Friday for reportedly trying to burn down the auditorium. Earlier, the MLA threatened to beat Faruqui for his alleged comments on Lord Ram.

386.title: India win 14th straight ODI vs Zimbabwe, record their 10th series win of 2022
386.article_body: India defeated Zimbabwe by five wickets in the second ODI in Harare to take an unassailable 2-0 lead in the three-match series. India have now won 14 ODIs in a row against Zimbabwe. Further, India have now won 10 series across formats in international cricket in 2022. The third Zimbabwe-India ODI will take place on Monday.

387.title: World no. 1 Medvedev enters 2nd consecutive semi-final at Cincinnati Open
387.article_body: World number one Daniil Medvedev and fourth seed Stefanos Tsitsipas entered the semi-finals at the Cincinnati Open after defeating Americans Taylor Fritz and John Isner on Friday. Medvedev beat Taylor Fritz 7-6(7-1), 6-3, while Tsitsipas defeated John Isner 7-6(7-5), 5-7, 6-3. Medvedev, who reached his second straight semi-final in Cincinnati, will face Tsitsipas on Saturday.

388.title: Telangana BJP Prez calls for boycott of Munawar Faruqui's Hyd show
388.article_body: Telangana BJP President Bandi Sanjay Kumar called for the boycott of comedian Munawar Faruqui's show to be held in Hyderabad on Saturday. "As if the comedy circus of TRS govt run by a bunch of clowns...isn't enough, now they're bringing Munawar Faruqui," tweeted Kumar. He alleged that Faruqui had demeaned Lord Ram and Goddess Sita in the name of comedy.

389.title: Army team treks 213 km of unexplored Ladakh terrain in 12 days
389.article_body: The Indian Army's 14-member 'Snow Leopard Brigade' completed a trek in Ladakh covering 213 km of unexplored terrain in 12 days. "Trekking expedition from Rumtse to Nyoma through tough terrain with heights ranging from 14,000 feet to 18,000 feet," tweeted Indian Army's Northern Command. In July, an 11-member team trekked 162 km of rugged terrain in Himachal Pradesh.

390.title: Want to discuss Delhi's excise policy in monsoon session: BJP
390.article_body: Leader of Opposition in the Delhi Assembly, Ramvir Singh Bidhuri, on Saturday alleged the CM Arvind Kejriwal-led government had given permission to open liquor vends in non-conforming areas. He demanded the monsoon session be called to discuss the city's excise policy. "While the liquor sales have gone up...the government's revenue from it hasn't. Why so?" he further asked.

391.title: It's my fault, need to understand what people want: Akshay on films' failure
391.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about his recent films not working at the box office, said, "If my films aren't working, it's my fault." "I have to make the changes, I have to understand what the audience wants," Akshay said, adding, "I want to make changes, I want to dismantle my way of working. Nobody else is to be blamed but me."

392.title: Harnaaz teaches B'wood dance steps to comedian Trevor Noah, shares video
392.article_body: Miss Universe Harnaaz Sandhu recently appeared on 'The Daily Show with Trevor Noah' and shared a video from the sets on her Instagram handle. In the video, Harnaaz could be seen teaching some Bollywood dance steps to the show's host and comedian Trevor Noah. "It was such a pleasure to share the stage with one and only @trevornoah," she wrote.

393.title: 25 injured after bus rams into truck in UP's Etah
393.article_body: Twenty-five people were injured after a roadways bus rammed into a stationary truck near Keelramau village in UP's Etah district. All 25 injured people were passengers inside the bus which was travelling from Farrukhabad to Delhi. Notably, the injured have been admitted to the Etah Medical College hospital. According to the passengers, the driver was driving at high speed.

394.title: Pune selected for C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards
394.article_body: Pune city has been picked as a finalist in the 2022 C40 Cities Bloomberg Philanthropies Awards in the “United to clean the air we breathe” category. Pune has been selected in recognition of the electrification of public transport buses in the Pune Metropolitan Area. Pune’s public transport system will have 650 electric buses by the end of 2022, authorities said.

395.title: Bengaluru woman's plan to get husband killed fails; lover dies by suicide
395.article_body: A Bengaluru woman's plan to get her husband killed failed after the contract killers she and her boyfriend had hired sent them a photo that seemingly confirmed the murder. Fearing arrest, Himavanth, Anupallavi's lover, died by suicide while Anupallavi's husband, Naveen, surprisingly returned after two weeks and said that he had befriended the contract killers during his kidnapping, police said.

396.title: 5 arrested for stealing laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh in Noida
396.article_body: A group of five men wanted in connection with multiple theft cases in Noida was arrested for allegedly stealing more than 22 laptops worth ₹6.5 lakh, Noida Police said on Friday. According to police, the accused broke into the premises of two IT companies in Noida's Sector 63 during the early hours of July 30 and stole 27 laptops.

397.title: 40-yr-old Hyderabad man ends life over harassment from loan agents
397.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Ravinder Yadav, allegedly died by suicide in Hyderabad after being harassed over repayment of money he borrowed through online applications. He was employed in a private company and lived with his wife and two children. "In their complaint, relatives alleged Yadav...had obtained loans...and failed to repay it, was being threatened by unknown persons over phone," police said.

398.title: I-T Dept raids J'khand hotel in search of Partha Chatterjee's aide
398.article_body: The Income Tax Department conducted a raid at a hotel in Jharkhand's Hazaribag district in search of an alleged close aide of West Bengal's ex-minister Partha Chatterjee. The department had received input from the Enforcement Directorate that the person was in Jharkhand's Bhandara Park to allegedly hide unaccounted money. He reportedly left the hotel hours before the I-T team arrived.

399.title: Mediation important tool for desperately congested courts: SC judge
399.article_body: Supreme Court judge Justice DY Chandrachud said mediation is an important tool in reducing pendency in the "extremely burdened" and "desperately congested" courts of India. The judge quoted data which said lower courts have pendency of 4.1 crore cases, while high courts have about 59 lakh cases. He said the pandemic has worsened the already alarming pendency in the system.

400.title: BJP leader said one must give ₹2,500 cr for K'taka CM post: Cong MLC
400.article_body: As per a report, Congress MLC BK Hariprasad has alleged that there are too many aspirants for the post of Karnataka Chief Minister and there is "big money" involved. "According to a [senior BJP] leader, one should cough up ₹ 2,500 crore," Hariprasad added. BJP leader Prabhu Chavan said, "This is just a lie. CM's seat is not for sale."
